title: Barcelona set to sign Watford right-back Juanfran Moreno to replace Aleix Vidal following ankle injury against Alaves
text:
Wat a strange Juan Barcelona set to sign Watford right-back Juanfran Moreno to replace Aleix Vidal following ankle injury against Alaves 
Juanfran joined the Hornets in 2014 but hasn't played a single game for the club By SAM STREET Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments BARCELONA are incredibly set to sign Watford right-back Juanfran Moreno, who hasn’t played a single game for the club. 
The defender joined the Hornets for £1.5m from Betis in 2014 but has been sent on loan to Deportivo for each of the last three seasons. 4 Juanfran hasn’t played a single game at Vicarage Road 
Keep up to date with ALL the La Liga news, gossip and transfers 
And according to Marca , they have plumped for the Hornets right-back, with Sergi Roberto struggling to fill in in defence after Vidal’s horrific ankle injury at Alaves. 
Deportivo have an option to buy Juanfran at the end of the season, but the defender reportedly has a £6.75m release clause in his contract which can be triggered with Watford’s approval. Getty Images Juanfran is Barcelona’s top target to replace Aleix Vidal EPA Vidal suffered a horrific ankle injury at Alaves Getty Images 4 If Juanfran signs he will not be allowed to play in the Champions League, where Barcelona lost 4-0 at PSG last week 
Hornets owners the Pozzo family have repeatedly made clear to the local press that Juanfran is not in their plans at Vicarage Road. 
A loophole in Spain’s transfer rules states that clubs can make ’emergency transfers’ outside the January and summer windows if they sign players already based in the country. Barcelona boss Luis Enrique restrained by THREE people as he lashes out at reporter 
But Juanfran would not be able to play in the Champions League as Barcelona's squad has already been submitted. 
The Catalans lost 4-0 at PSG last week and are likely to turn their attention to the La Liga campaign barring a miracle in the second leg at the Nou Camp.
